items.title: How a runway change led to two 'terrifying' near misses at this Australian airport
items.summary: According to a report, both aircraft flew so close to an active airport site that jet blast affected the area.

items.title: Deadly Delhi car explosion being investigated under anti-terrorism law, police say
items.summary: Eyewitnesses described how the car exploded in traffic and that people caught up in the surge of flames were set on fire.

items.title: 'No other alternative': Howard weighs in on Whitlam's controversial dismissal
items.summary: John Howard, part of the Opposition at the time of the dismissal, said then governor-general Sir John Kerr made the right call.

items.title: 'Blind spot': Researchers warn of hidden crisis undercutting environmental progress
items.summary: Experts say the issue may be far more widespread than is recognised — and we should be keeping track.

items.title: Torres Strait Islander leaders appeal landmark climate case against Australian Government
items.summary: It is the latest step in the long-running battle two Uncles are waging in defence of their homeland.

items.title: How to plan for your child’s financial future in Australia
items.summary: Financial planning can feel stressful for any parent. When it comes to saving for your child’s future, knowing your options helps make informed decisions. And teaching your kid healthy money habits can be part of the process.

items.title: Trump threatens BBC with $1.5 billion lawsuit over January 6 speech edit
items.summary: In a letter to the BBC, Trump's legal team demanded the outlet "immediately retract" the program, calling it "false and defamatory".

items.title: Anthony Albanese labels Gough Whitlam's dismissal 'a calculated plot'
items.summary: Five decades on, the Labor prime minister has weighed in on one of the most dramatic moments in Australia's political history.

items.title: Activists accuse NSW of double standards, reject more police powers after neo-Nazi rally
items.summary: A neo-Nazi rally held outside NSW Parliament on Saturday was given authorisation by police.

items.title: France's Nicolas Sarkozy freed from prison three weeks into five-year sentence
items.summary: Sarkozy entered jail on 21 October, becoming the first former head of a European Union state to be incarcerated.

items.title: 'We now have a group chat': How five single mothers came together to reveal a love scam
items.summary: A group of Chinese Australian single mothers were shocked to discover they'd all dated the same man — in some cases at the same time.

items.title: A historic native title claim encompassing Melbourne has been lodged with the Federal Court
items.summary: The Wurundjeri Woi-Wurrung people's claim stretches almost 200 kilometres from the Werribee River to Mount Gregory.

items.title: Politicians, radio industry and friends pay tribute to 'radio icon' John Laws
items.summary: Talkback king John Laws and his golden tonsils became very rich, very influential and very controversial.

items.title: US Senate takes first step toward ending longest-ever government shutdown
items.summary: The deal still needs to pass the House and be sent to US President Donald Trump for his signature, a process that could take days.

items.title: This form of discrimination is growing in Australia - from assault to segregated birthday parties
items.summary: H&M says it discovered widespread payroll discrepancies dating back to 2016 and has launched a remediation process, including back pay.

items.title: I contracted a disease not officially transmitted in Australia. To save myself, I had to leave
items.summary: Lara Ryan says she contracted Lyme disease in Australia, most likely while camping. She had to travel overseas to receive the treatment she needed.

items.title: Four dead, one million evacuated as Typhoon Fung-wong slams into the Philippines
items.summary: The state weather agency said the typhoon was now moving over the South China Sea and is forecast to shift northeast towards Taiwan.

items.title: Who are the NSW finalists for the 2026 Australian of the Year Awards?
items.summary: The nominees include the inventor of coral baby food, a lawyer fighting for LGBTIQ+ hate crime victims, and the world's oldest cowboy.

items.title: The Alzheimer's 'imbalance' this Australian has under the microscope
items.summary: The researcher hopes to uncover clues to explain one group is particularly at risk.

items.title: Hundreds missing after boat carrying Rohingya migrants sinks off Malaysian coast
items.summary: At least seven people have died and hundreds are missing after a boat carrying Rohingya migrants sank off the coast of Malaysia.

items.title: The first Miss Palestine hopes to make history in the 'Olympics of women's beauty'
items.summary: This year's Miss Universe will include Miss Palestine for the first time. But do beauty pageants have an impact outside of the arena?

items.title: Report of single gunshot opens up a new line of inquiry in the search for Dezi Freeman
items.summary: Police are investigating reports of a gunshot heard in the vicinity moments after Dezi Freeman allegedly opened fire, killing two officers.

items.title: One million permanent humanitarian visas: Calls for change as milestone nears
items.summary: While advocates celebrate Australia's one millionth permanent humanitarian visa, experts also say Australia needs to reassess its approach.

items.title: Nearly one in 10 Australians believe violence can be justified by political causes, study finds
items.summary: The new annual survey has been set up to measure Australia's democratic health.
